message.content:
cs.SE, cs.PL, cs.SD, cs.CR, cs.MS 

This paper proposes a framework for effective mutation testing of Android apps. The paper focuses on software engineering (SE) aspects of testing and mutation testing, which makes cs.SE the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the implementation of mutation operators, which falls under programming languages (PL), making cs.PL another likely sub-category. The paper analyzes software artifacts to devise a taxonomy of Android faults, which is related to software design (SD), making cs.SD another possible sub-category. The paper also evaluates the proposed taxonomy and operators in terms of their capacity to represent real faults, which is related to software testing (CR), making cs.CR another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper uses statistical analysis to evaluate the effectiveness of the proposed framework, which falls under machine learning (MS), making cs.MS another possible sub-category.
